poem:
Title: "The Company of Solitude"

In silence, I bought and sold,
weaving through days like a rug's fold.
A brief exchange, quite polite,
then onto the quiet, hushed twilight.
I make calls, my voice like birds,
spoken yet scarcely heard.
Alone with my thoughts, I take stride,
my company, always by my side.
In my solitude, never lost,
it is a kind, forgiving host.
